result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant John E. Fink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any therapy or educational programming ordered by the agent.

Pay costs of supervision and one set of court costs.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

0 days credit in the event of revocation.

Probation is for counts 2 and 3.  There is a diversion agreement on count 1.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Concurrent with: Count 2

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John E. Fink in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states parties are prepared to go to resolution; def to waive right to prelim; State to file information with 3 counts.  Atty. McDougal presents Court with plea questionnaire/waiver and diversion agreement of the parties.  DA notes that the parties' agreement calls for def's pleas to counts 1, 2, and 3 for diversion agreement on count 1 and probation on counts 2 and 3.  Counsel and Def address the Court.  Court approves diversion agreement for count 1.  For counts 2 and 3, Court withholds sentence for probation of 2 years with conditions to include:  attend, pay for, and succ. complete any therapy or education ordered by agent; pay costs (1 set); def to stop at RCSD and submit DNA sample before leaving the courthouse today; sign up for probation today.  0 days credit.

Defendant John E. Fink in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court that negotiations continue; further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John E. Fink in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Court states charges and informs def of rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M waives prelim time limits.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
